requirements: Knowledge of Project Management
courses.description:
Welcome to an engaging online course led by Jamal, a seasoned project management consultant with 25 years of experience in creating Work Breakdown Structures (WBS) for diverse projects. Drawing from his extensive consulting background, Jamal has designed this course to help you master the art of creating a great WBS.
Throughout this training, you will gain valuable insights and practical techniques to develop effective WBS for your projects. You'll explore the optimal size of work packages and different levels within the WBS. Understanding the relationship between WBS element numbering and their corresponding levels will be a key focus.
The course covers various approaches to work breakdown structure decomposition. You'll learn about the generic approach, which aligns with typical project management phases such as initiation, planning, execution, monitoring and control, and closeout. The IT and software development approach will be explored, covering concept, requirements, design, development, testing, release project management, and business analysis. Additionally, you'll dive into the Agile approach, including sprints, system testing, and closeout.
Proper naming conventions for work breakdown structure work packages using the "Verb + Noun Construct" will be emphasized, and you'll have the opportunity to examine a simple WBS created for a "Room Painting" project.
Furthermore, the course delves into recommended time quotas for project management activities across various project phases. You'll gain insights into the key tasks performed by project managers during initiation, planning, execution, and closeout.
To enhance your learning experience, the course provides multiple examples of generic, IT/software development, and Agile WBS approaches. You'll also have access to valuable WBS "cheat sheets" to serve as handy references.
Join us now to acquire the skills necessary to create a great WBS. Unlock the ability to effectively decompose projects, define work packages, and lay a solid foundation for successful project management.

courses.title: Scrum Master Certification
courses.bio: Scrum Master Certification by Agile Enterprise Coach, London
courses.description:
Course Description:
Scrum Master  Certification/ Assessment


Unlock the Full Potential of Agile with the Scrum Master Certification Assessment from Agile Enterprise Coach
Welcome to the Scrum Master  Assessment, comprehensive evaluations designed for individuals seeking to confirm their understanding and proficiency in the Scrum framework. This assessment is not a theoretical course but a practical examination that reflects real-world scenarios and applications of Scrum, as outlined in the Official Scrum Guide.


Note: This course is only having exams/ assessments and does not have any videos or theory.


For Employees/ Individuals: Advance Your Agile Career
As an aspiring or current Scrum Master or Product Owner, this assessment will serve as a benchmark for your Scrum and Product Ownership knowledge and skills, allowing you to:
Validate Expertise: Demonstrate your mastery of the Scrum framework and stand out in a competitive job market.
Professional Development: Identify your strengths and areas for growth, guiding your learning journey in Agile practices.
Career Advancement: Enhance your resume and LinkedIn profile with the certification, opening doors to new opportunities and career growth.
Credibility and Recognition: Gain the confidence of peers and employers with a certification that showcases your commitment to the Agile mindset.


For Organisations/Scrum Teams : Elevate Your Team's Agile Capabilities
In the fast-paced world of technology and product management, Agile methodologies have become the cornerstone of successful product delivery. Implementing Scrum within your organization can revolutionize the way you manage projects, enhance team collaboration, and drive better product outcomes. Our Scrum Master Certification Assessment offers numerous advantages for your organisation:
Skill Validation: Ensure that your Scrum team members possess a solid understanding of Scrum practices, principles, and values.
Team Efficiency: Identify Scrum Masters who can lead and facilitate Agile teams to higher levels of productivity and efficiency.
Continuous Improvement: Pinpoint areas where your teams excel and where they need further training, fostering a culture of continuous learning and development.
Competitive Edge: By having certified Scrum Masters, your company can stay ahead of the curve in Agile product management, attracting clients and projects that value certified expertise.


The Role of a Scrum Master: Facilitator of Agile Excellence
The Scrum Master is a pivotal role within Scrum teams, acting as a facilitator, coach, and servant leader. As a Scrum Master, you are responsible for:
Ensuring Scrum Adoption: Guide your team in following Scrum practices, principles, and rules as described in the Official Scrum Guide.
Facilitating Scrum Events: Conduct effective Sprint Planning, Daily Scrums, Sprint Reviews, and Sprint Retrospectives to maximize collaboration and progress.
Impediment Removal: Address and eliminate obstacles that hinder your team's performance, ensuring a smooth path to project completion.
Coaching and Mentoring: Empower your team by promoting self-organization, cross-functionality, and continuous improvement in Agile practices.


Why Choose Our Scrum Master Certification Assessments?
Our assessment is meticulously crafted to reflect the depth and breadth of the Scrum framework as per the Official Scrum Guide. Here’s what sets our Scrum Master Certification Assessment apart:
Real-World Relevance: Questions are designed to challenge and reflect real-life scenarios that Scrum Masters encounter, ensuring practical understanding.
Comprehensive Coverage: The assessment spans all essential Scrum topics, from roles and artifacts to events, providing a thorough evaluation of your Scrum knowledge.
Instant Feedback: Upon completion, receive immediate insights into your performance, helping you to pinpoint questions for further study or confirmation of your expertise.
Scrum Master Certificate: Successful candidates can request a Scrum Master Certificate for this course to be issued by Agile Enterprise coach, adding a tangible credential to their professional portfolio.


Assessment Structure and Content for Scrum Master  Certification Assessment
The Scrum Master Certification Assessment consists of a series of multiple-choice questions covering a wide range of topics, including but not limited to:
Scrum Theory and Principles
The Scrum Team: Roles and Responsibilities
Scrum Events: Sprint Planning, Daily Scrum, Sprint Review, and Sprint Retrospective
Scrum Artifacts: Product Backlog, Sprint Backlog, and Increment
Definition of Done


How to Get Certified as Scrum Master  from Agile Enterprise Coach, London:
Study the Official Scrum Guide: Familiarize yourself with all the concepts and guidelines.
Take the Assessment: Complete the multiple-choice questions to the best of your ability.
Submit Proof of Completion: Send us screenshots of your completed tests to us to receive your Scrum Master and Product Owner Certificates from Agile Enterprise Coach.
Add to Your Credentials: Include your certification in your CV . For assistance with obtaining your certificate, please reach out to us via email to info at agileenterprisecoach dot eu.




About Me: Vipesh Singla, MBA, Agile Enterprise Coach
Embark on a journey of transformation with Vipesh Singla, a seasoned Agile Enterprise Coach with an impressive track record. Certified and licensed as a SAFe Agile Coach and SAFe Practice Consultant, I bring a wealth of experience to the table.
Throughout my career, I have played pivotal roles in Agile Transformations and Product Management Assignments for a diverse array of Global 2000 companies. Notably, I've collaborated with esteemed clients and employers from prestigious groups such as GAFAM, Big 4, Big Tech, Big Pharma, Fortune 100, and FTSE 100. My versatility shines through various roles, including Product Manager, Product Owner, Scrum Master, and Agile Coach.
Education forms the foundation of my expertise, holding both an MBA and a Bachelor of Engineering degree from one of India's prestigious institutes. As a certified SAFe SPC/Agile Coach, I bring a proven track record of driving successful Agile transformations.
With a track record that speaks volumes, I am proud to be at the forefront of Agile and Scrum coaching. Boasting a remarkable achievement of over 150,000 registrations across all my programs, I have had the privilege of influencing and guiding a diverse community of 70,000 unique students.
My digital presence extends globally, reaching enthusiasts and professionals in 152 countries. This widespread outreach has allowed me to connect with a vast audience, transcending language barriers. Our community is not confined to English alone; we thrive in a multilingual environment, with students conversing in 40 languages.
As an Agile Enterprise Coach, my commitment is to empower individuals worldwide with the knowledge and skills necessary for success in the dynamic field of product management. Join me on this transformative journey, and let's navigate the realm of Agile Product Management together.




Conclusion
Whether you're an individual looking to solidify your Scrum expertise or a company aiming to enhance your team's Agile practices, our Scrum Master Certification Assessment is the stepping stone to achieving professional excellence in Agile project management. Embrace the opportunity to validate your knowledge, improve your skills, and advance your career with our Scrum Master Professional Certification Assessment.

courses.description:
Welcome to the course Monday : Project Management For Beginners.
The only course you need to get started with Monday and to start managing projects effectively as a project manager.
This course is developed on the latest user interface.
Here Is What You Get By Enrolling In This Course:
Word-By-Word Explanation: In the entire hands on course, I explain each and every step along the way.
Awesome Quality Content: Over 5+ hours of HD Videos.
Well Structured & Easy To Learn: Course has been specially designed to make it easy for the students to learn Monday starting from a basic level and gradually moving up to advance concepts.
24 X 7 Support: I will always be there to guide you in your journey to become a Monday expert.
Let's take a look at what exactly we will be learning in the course.
The entire course is divided into 10 major sections.


Section 1: Introduction to Monday.
We will first start off by learning what exactly Monday is and what are the different use cases of Monday.
As Monday is a versatile tool, it has multiple applications and you need to be familiar with the different use cases Monday has.
We will learn the different pricing plans Monday has to offer as well as learn how to setup an account on Monday.


Section 2: Creating workflows in Monday.
After having a brief introduction about Monday, we will then learn how to start using the platform.
We will learn what are workspaces in Monday and  how to create multiple workspaces.
We will learn how to add boards and groups to these workspaces and learn how to add items or tasks to boards and groups.
We will learn how to invite members to join our boards, create teams and assign tasks to members and teams.


Section 3: Columns.
Columns allow you to define attributes for the tasks you have in your workflow, in this section we will learn about how we could use columns to define our tasks. We will learn the different type of columns Monday has to offer and what are the uses of different column types.
We will learn how to add column descriptions and also learn how to add subitems to the already present items to create a hierarchical structure in our tasks.


Section 4: Updates & Notifications.
As Monday is a collaboration tool, being able to communicate with teams is a crucial feature to have. Monday provides us the ability to communicate with teams and its members using a feature called updates. Using updates we could contextualise team communication and collaboration around a specific task.
Notification is another feature which Monday provides so that all the team members stay up-to-date with the tasks and items which are relevant to them. We will learn the different types of notifications Monday has to offer and how and when a specific member of the team will be notified.


Section 5: Search & Filtering
Monday also provides us the ability to search anything across all the boards using the search anything feature.
Using which we could search anything related to our project by using keywords. This feature makes using Monday more efficient as we could quickly find tasks, updates and files without having to scroll through them. It also provides the ability to add multiple filters all at once so that we could filter out items on our boards as per our needs. It allows us to perform filtering on the basis of multiple parameters.


Section 6: Dashboard & Widgets
Monday also provides us a feature to create reports and summaries of the current project status. We could generate dynamic reports using the Dashboards and widgets provided my Monday. There are multiple pre-built widgets which could be used to visualise and report data, the only thing we need to do is set parameters to these widgets and they will pull data from our workflows and report it inside the dashboard.
This feature also allows us to export these dashboards as PDF files and print and share them with anyone we want to.


Section 7: Working With Files
While working and collaborating on projects, you need to share and exchange files. Monday allows you to upload, download and collaborate with files. It has the ability to upload different versions of a file and communicate on them by the means of updates. We could also control the permissions so as to which members or teams are able to access certain files.


Section 8: Automation & Integrations
Monday provides us a feature to automate certain mundane and repetitive tasks in our boards thereby reducing the time and effort required to do them. There are multiple pre-built automation recipes provided by Monday which could be used to automate almost anything within the Monday platform. Integration allows us to integrate Monday with other external platforms and tools like GitHub, Asana, Slack, Gmail and a lot more. It allows us to perform automations inside these platforms by integrating Monday with them.


Section 9: Exploring Features
In this section we will explore some additional advanced features provided by Monday. We will start off by learning how to use the formula column in Monday which allows us to dynamically update a cell value by creating a formula. We will also learn how to share our Monday boards with external users like clients and freelancers. Along with it, we will also explore a lot more features such as, exporting to Excel, creating templates from boards, using themes & shortcuts, conditional colouring, batch actions, deadline mode & bolt switch.


Section 10: Project
This section consist of a final project which allows you to summarise every concept you have learned in the course. We will build a workflow for a company by adding the project approval process. We will setup automations to create the approval process, we will learn how we could create a board dynamically from a template whenever a project is approved, we will also learn how to move project related tasks along different project phases. We will also learn how to create multiple views for the board to track budget, expenses and project performance. Finally we learn how to create a detailed dashboard to create a summary of activities across various boards.


In addition to the Udemy 30-day money back guarantee, you have my personal guarantee that you will love what you learn in this course. If you ever have any questions please feel free to message me directly and I will do my best to get back to you as soon as possible!


Make sure to enrol in the course before the price changes.
Take yourself one step closer towards becoming a professional Django developer by clicking the "take this course button" now!
Join the journey.
Sincerely,
Ashutosh Pawar

courses.description:
Many organizations do not fully understand the value of Project Management. Hence, as a Project Manager, you have very little authority and made to work on trivial tasks. You might be made redundant if you do not bring any value add in your PM role,  In today’s world, with more emphasis on automation, cost-cutting, agility – it is very important to show the benefits you bring to your organization or your team in the PM role
I have worked as a PM in big organizationss as well as startups. I had always felt that most of the organization do not understand the value and importance of a Project Manager.  While the senior managerss see the PMs as a person to provide the status reports, the team members think that a PM is a word or an excel expert. They fail to see the value add that a PM brings in a project.
With this course, I will try to create awareness among the PMs to add value in their projects. They should become the most valueable employees in their organizations
In this course, I will talk about
- Roles which should NOT be considered as a PM role as they dilute the PM’s responsibility and authority.
- Best practices which can help you shine in the PM role and eventually make you a valuable resource in your organization.


I created this course from the webinar delivered earlier in the PMI forum.
Few Review comments on the webinar:
"Awesome insights. I loved the approach and the example showcased."
"A good and informative presentation. your term "paper pm" fits a few that I have had to deal with in my early years."

"Very good - it's comforting to know that so many of us struggle with the same issues. Some good tips here to help flip the script, though. Thanks, Anju!"

courses.description:
The Validate and Control Scope (PMI - PMP) is course 8 of 28 of the Project Management Professional Certification Program (PMI-PMP). The course is aligned with the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK6) developed by the Project Management Institute (PMI).
There are three priorities you'll have as project manager. To make sure your projects meets stakeholder expectations and to make sure the project comes in on time and on budget.
In this course you'll learn about two processes that help you meet those obligations, validate scope and control scope. In validate scope, you formalize acceptance of the scope by all parties. And in control scope you manage changes to the scope baseline. Both of these processes are critical to project success.
1. Validating Project Scope
2. Inputs to Validate Scope
3. Validate Scope versus Control Quality
4. Outputs of Validate Scope
5. The Control Scope Process
6. Inputs to Control Scope
7. Performing a Variance Analysis
8. Outputs of Control Scope
9. Exercise: Validating and Controlling Scope
The importance of schedule control can't be overstated. Every project, no matter how well-planned, encounters unexpected roadblocks and delays. The skills you learn in this course will directly translate into your ability to identify potential problems early, analyze their impact, and develop effective solutions. This proactive approach is the difference between projects that spiral out of control and projects that successfully meet their goals. By mastering schedule control, you'll gain the confidence to navigate challenges, minimize disruptions, and ensure your project stays on track for a successful outcome.
That’s it! Now go ahead and push that “Take this course” button, and see you on the inside!

What is a “Kill” category

requirements: Knowledge of Project Management
courses.description:
Welcome to an online course led by Jamal, an internationally acclaimed expert in project and portfolio management with over 25 years of experience. This course is a result of Jamal's extensive background in project portfolio methodology implementation across various companies worldwide.
Throughout this training, you will delve into the core concepts of project portfolio management, with a particular focus on the significance of scoring models in project prioritization and selection. You will gain insight into the process of identifying appropriate scoring variables, the potential challenges posed by the "halo effect," and the crucial role of measurability in project evaluation.
The course explores different strategies for project prioritization, encompassing both aligned and non-aligned approaches with organizational strategies. By aligning projects effectively, you will optimize resource allocation and enhance the achievement of strategic objectives. Furthermore, you will examine the intriguing concept of the "joker," where projects deemed lower in score may still warrant implementation based on management considerations.
Jamal's expertise extends to a range of industries including banking, finance, retail, e-commerce, oil and gas, and software development. Leveraging his vast experience in managing and recovering troubled projects, Jamal imparts practical insights and actionable techniques.
Through interactive lessons, real-world case studies, and practical examples, this course equips you with the skills necessary to implement scoring matrix methodologies and make informed decisions when it comes to project prioritization. Whether you are a project manager, aspiring professional, or involved in corporate training, this course provides valuable knowledge to excel in the field of project management.
Join us now to gain a deep understanding of effective scoring matrix and prioritization techniques, enabling you to drive successful project outcomes.

courses.description:
Project Management Basics for Project Managers – 16 PDUs
Course Instructor: Nilotpal Ray, PMP, PRINCE2 Practitioner, MBA
Unlock the potential of a fulfilling career with our comprehensive Project Management tutorial. Designed for those pursuing project manager jobs, advancing their skills, or seeking certifications like CAPM, PMP, PRINCE2, PMI-CP, PMI-SP, PMI-PBA, PgMP, PfMP, and PMI-ACP, this course equips you with everything you need to succeed in project management.
With over 16 hours of video tutorials and 16+ PDUs/CPDs, this course offers valuable tools, knowledge, and real-world scenarios to guide you on your path to becoming an exceptional project manager.
This course focuses on the following aspects of a typical waterfall/predictive project management:
In the Initiation phase, the project’s feasibility and value are assessed, defining the purpose and objectives and identifying key stakeholders. A project charter is created to formally authorize the project, outlining the goals, scope, and high-level plan.
Moving into the Planning phase, a comprehensive roadmap is developed. This includes detailed plans for scope, schedule, budget, quality standards, resources, risk management, and communication strategies, creating a blueprint to ensure the project remains on track and well-coordinated.
The Execution phase then focuses on delivering the project according to the established plan. Resources are allocated, tasks are managed, and stakeholder communication is facilitated to ensure project objectives are met and deliverables are produced effectively.
During Monitoring and Controlling, project performance is continuously measured to verify alignment with the plan, enabling proactive adjustments to stay on schedule, within scope, and on budget.
Finally, the Closeout phase wraps up the project by confirming that all deliverables meet the required standards, gathering lessons learned, and closing any outstanding documentation. This phase formally completes the project, providing a record of its outcomes and any insights for future projects. Together, these five phases enable project managers to maintain control, ensure quality, and deliver successful project outcomes.
This course covers everything you need to know for the phases as delineated above.
Course Highlights:  Acquire the Essential Skills to Manage Projects from Start to Finish
Build Comprehensive Project Management Knowledge: Master core project management concepts to lead entire projects confidently, from planning through execution to successful closure.

Earn 15+ PDUs/CPDs for your Project Management Certifications: Ideal for renewing certifications like CAPM, PMP, PRINCE2, PfMP, PgMP, PMI-CP, PMI-SP, PMI-PBA, and more.
Professional Knowledge and Best Practices for Career Success

Learn Core Theories and Best Practices: Study key project management frameworks, best practices, and methodologies to become a well-rounded project management professional.
Master MS Project Essentials: Gain a foundational overview of Microsoft Project, develop project schedules, and analyze critical paths to ensure timely and efficient project delivery.
Additional Features and Certifications Overview
Learn about Project Management Certifications: Discover beginner to advanced certifications that open doors in the project management field, including CAPM, PMP, PRINCE2, PgMP, PfMP, PMI-ACP, PMI-CP, PMI-SP, and PMI-PBA.

courses.description:
The goal of this course is to help inexperienced or new NEC3 contract users to understand the correct way of managing an NEC3 programme and be able to advise their teams on the best practices and to avoid many pitfalls people fall into.
By the end of this course, my objective is for you to have established a well-rounded and a robust understanding of how the programme mechanism works under the NEC3 contract.
On completion you should be fully accustomed to:
Brief history of the NEC and the contract's ethos
What and how a programme is used for under the ECC3, NEC3 contract
What information should go into a programme
Understanding different roles, responsibilities and key obligations for all parties
The importance of having an accepted programme
Understanding the pitfalls of not submitting or accepting programmes regularly
How to deal with common misconceptions which lead to resistance of accepting a programme
And understand the best practices for revising programmes
You will also know the different types of float and how it’s used
What Time Risk Allowances (TRAs) are and how they are used
Knowledge of critical paths
You will have an understanding how Early Warning mechanism works with the programme
And how the compensation event mechanism works with the programme to secure an extension of time
You should also know how the Acceleration mechanism works with the programme
And how to deal with multiple compensation events and movement of Completion Date
You will be fully accustomed to what is considered Completion, any changes to Completion
And the entitlement the contractor has to finish early
We will also touch on design and how to use the programme to manage the design process
And finally you will have some awareness of Retrospective Analysis of programmes & ‘Forensic Planning’
And Z Clauses impacting on programmes
Knowing all of this, will put you ahead of a lot of construction professionals that don’t take the time to learn best practices, learn from other people’s mistakes or try to perfect their trade.
Knowledge becomes power when you are able to use it to solve problems, the more knowledge you have, the more problems you will be able to solve, which will make you more sought after and open the doors for you to bigger opportunities.
I will therefore present the information in a clear and concise manner, utilising checklists, cheat sheets, provide real life tricks of the trade, templates and examples so the information is immediate and practical, so you can use it straight away.
I will use best practices for information retention and consolidation by using quizzes and further study recommendations and on completion will provide certifications with my courses for Continuous Professional Development (CPD) which are structured to comply with CIOB & RICS CPD requirements.

courses.description:
This comprehensive course is designed to equip project management professionals with the practical knowledge, tools, and skills to harness the transformative power of Generative AI in modern project environments. As AI continues to redefine workflows and accelerate decision-making, project managers must evolve into AI-literate leaders capable of leveraging intelligent systems for enhanced efficiency, accuracy, and foresight.
Beginning with a foundational understanding of what Generative AI is and its critical role in project management, the course explores the scope and impact of AI across planning, execution, communication, and reporting. Learners will examine real-world case studies of Generative AI adoption in PMI-certified organizations, gaining insights into best practices and implementation strategies.
Core modules focus on integrating AI into key project artifacts such as project charters, SMART goal generation, WBS development, and Gantt chart optimization. Participants will master the use of AI for task prioritization, dependency mapping, CPM scheduling, and automated reminders, as well as cost estimation, budget forecasting, and cost-benefit analysis.
The course emphasizes stakeholder alignment through LLM-powered stakeholder mapping, AI-drafted communication plans, and negotiation scenario simulations. It also dives into risk management, issue tracking, and audit-readiness—empowered by AI tools for identification, analysis, and resolution.
Further, students will explore AI’s role in team skill mapping, onboarding document creation, and Scrum facilitation, along with modules on KPI monitoring, quality checks, agile ceremonies, and hybrid project environments. The course culminates in access to 1,000+ expertly crafted AI prompts, tailored for project management use cases, ensuring learners can immediately apply their knowledge to real-world contexts.
Whether managing Agile sprints or enterprise-scale programs, this course enables professionals to lead with intelligence, agility, and digital fluency—future-proofing their role in the AI-driven project era.
target_audience: Project Managers (Agile, Waterfall, Hybrid) looking to boost efficiency through AI-powered planning, scheduling, and risk analysis.

objectives: What are requirements? And how do they solve business needs?

Introduction: About the course - What you will learn
Gathering Requirements: Advantages and Disadvantages of Requirement Gathering Techniques

requirements: This course is beneficial to all working professionals at all levels - beginners to experts. It is especially useful for Project Managers and Business Analysts or those in similar roles. It helps explain what requirements are and how to gather requirements for an initiative or project they have been tasked with.
courses.description:
This Requirements Gathering course will teach you how to gather requirements and document them. It examines how to plan for requirements activities and covers the weaknesses and strengths in each. It will cover the ten essential elicitation techniques that are used by most BA's and PM's.
In today’s projects, the biggest success factor is how well the project requirements have been collected and validated. Requirements are the basic components that make up the scope of any project. Project managers and business analysts must plan and closely identify and manage requirements for a project in accordance with existing standards in an organization. First, they must identify key sources of requirements and develop a requirements gathering strategy. Working with requirements involves identifying the activities to be undertaken in order to identify requirements, and this course provides the steps to take before and after each requirements gathering technique.
This course is aligned with the Business Analysis Body of Knowledge® (BABOK®) published by the International Institute of Business Analysis (IIBA™), and can be used towards the training preparation for the IIBA’s Certified Business Analysis Professional™ (CBAP™) certification.
IIBA, Business Analysis Body of Knowledge, BABOK, Certified Business Analysis Professional, CBAP are registered trademarks owned by the International Institute of Business Analysis.

courses.description:
Embark on a transformative journey with Jamal, an esteemed expert in business analysis, as he equips you with the advanced skills needed to excel in all types of projects. In this comprehensive course, Jamal will unveil the secrets to successful project execution by focusing on the critical areas of requirements elicitation, planning, and project control.
Recent studies have highlighted the alarming statistics surrounding project success rates, with a mere 32% considered successful, 44% facing significant challenges, and 24% ending in outright failure. The key drivers behind these statistics are often attributed to poor requirements elicitation, inadequate planning, and ineffective project control.
Through this course, Jamal will empower participants to overcome these hurdles by instilling in them the necessary skills, tools, techniques, and economic principles that transcend organizational structures, environments, and project management philosophies. You will learn how to perform these crucial tasks with precision and efficiency.
With a strong focus on requirements elicitation, you will master the art of capturing and understanding stakeholder needs, translating them into actionable requirements, and ensuring alignment with project objectives. Jamal's expert guidance will enable you to navigate through various business analysis techniques and tools that facilitate effective requirements gathering.
Moving forward, you will delve into the realm of planning, where you will acquire the knowledge and techniques to develop comprehensive project plans. By understanding the interplay between project scope, schedule, budget, and resource allocation, you will be equipped to create robust plans that set your projects up for success.
Finally, Jamal will illuminate the importance of project control, demonstrating how to monitor, measure, and adjust project performance to ensure project objectives are achieved. You will explore proven techniques for tracking progress, managing risks, and addressing issues that may arise during project execution.
Join Jamal in this advanced business analysis course and unlock the key to project success. Whether you are a seasoned professional or a budding business analyst, this course will empower you to perform your role with excellence across diverse project landscapes. Elevate your skills, amplify your impact, and drive success in all types of projects.

requirements: No special requirements or prerequisites are needed to take this course, but some extra reading about projects, project management, project life cycle, organizational project management, project scope, project schedule, project costs, project quality, project human resources and project communications will help.
Part of the Project Management Professional Certification Course (PMI-PMP)
courses.description:
The Project Changes and Closing (PMI - PMP) is course 3 of 28 of the Project Management Professional Certification Program (PMI-PMP). The course is aligned with the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK6) developed by the Project Management Institute (PMI).
It happens every time. Your customer or team members come up with great ideas during a project of how the product could be so much better if. But that can be a sure recipe for disaster. This course teaches you how to apply the perform integrated change control process. It also explains the closed project or phase process. Guiding you how to ensure product acceptance, tie up loose ends, and assess the project's success.
1. Integrated Change Control
2. Configuration Management
3. Inputs to Perform Integrated Change Control
4. The Change Control Process
5. Outputs of Perform Integrated Change Control
6. Inputs to Close Project or Phase
7. Close Project or Phase Tools and Techniques
8. Outputs of the Close Project or Phase Process
9. Exercise: Managing Change and Closing the Project
Managing change effectively doesn't mean stifling innovation. This course will show you how to balance flexibility with project goals. You'll learn strategies for evaluating the potential impact of changes, making informed decisions collaboratively, and maintaining control of scope, schedule, and budget. Successful change management can elevate your project, impress your team and clients, and boost your career as a skilled project manager.
That’s it! Now go ahead and push that “Take this course” button, and see you on the inside!
target_audience: Leaders, managers, entrepreneurs, professionals and project workers with or without formal project management training will improve project management skills and knowledge and will be ready to stand for formal certification.

courses.description:
Are you considering to start as a project manager in consulting? Are you already working as a consultant and desire to become a project manager in the next step? Are you a newbie project manager? Do you really feel supported by the existing project management methodologies? Are you looking for a dedicated “to the point” guideline explaining how project management in consulting works in practice?
Then join this course and learn easy way what managing a consulting project is really all about!
All lectures contain a condensed summary of best practices from more than 13 years of experience working as a project manager on large-scale complex projects all over the globe. Supported by this Step-by-Step Guide you will be able to quickly grasp the nature of a consulting project while saving significant amount of time avoiding trial and error at the start of your career. Having passed this course you will be lifted up to the experience level of your “old hands” colleagues. You will be directly able to see “behind the scenes” which will save your time, enhance your performance and boost your competitive advantage as a specialist in project management.
The course will be taught from a case study perspective. We will be dealing with two fictive companies – one acting as a Contractor and another one acting as a client. Each party engages persons, who interact which each other during various project stages. One of these persons will be our project manager. Your learning process will be supported by getting direct insights in his daily work.
Your Instructor:
Dr. Eugen Truschkin graduated from Technical University of Berlin with a diploma in industrial engineering. He spent five years working as a research associate at two universities in Germany (Technical University of Berlin, Technical University of Darmstadt), being responsible for creating and holding lectures, managing research projects for both private and public authorities, and publishing his results in peer-reviewed journals.
Having defended his Dr. thesis, he joined a consulting company in Germany - a part of a transportation and logistics holding acting worldwide. Eugen has been a project manager for more than 13 years and is currently a Senior Project Manager in consulting responsible for managing large-scale projects in different industries around the globe. At the same time he teaches project management as a university lecturer and acts as a mentor for project managers and consultants who have recently started their career in this field.
What you’ll learn:
Essential theoretical foundation of project management – covering major tasks of a project manager, existing PM approaches (waterfall vs agile), stages of a consulting project.
What competencies are expected from a project manager.
How different mindsets and work approaches impact project management.
How the attractiveness of a project is assessed What are RFI and RFP.

What a typical contract structure looks like. How to draft crucial elements of your contract minimizing risks for your project.
How to control scope, time and cost – Dos and Dont’s. Templates to be used during the project execution.
What you’ll receive:
High quality video lectures with contents bringing project management in consulting “to the point”.
High quality downloadable handouts that you can always use as a supportive source of knowledge in your daily work.
E-book to the course
Real world downloadable project management templates as open source files.
Real world case by the end of the course to practice what you have learned.
Lifetime access to the course.
Instructor support in case you have any questions.
Why this course?
It is a tailor-made course for project management in consulting.
It includes concise TO-DO’s for each particular stage of a project life cycle.
It is taught from a case study perspective making project management in consulting tangible.
It provides you with the best practices from the instructor’s own experience working around the globe on different types of projects and interacting with other global players in consulting (MBB, Big4).
Your instructor has more than 15 years of teaching experience – both as a university lecturer and as a mentor for project managers and consultants who start their career.
Course updates on a regular basis with your lifetime access.

courses.description:
If you are looking for a course to learn about Scrum, start your preparation for any Scrum Certification exam or take the next step in your career ladder and start learning something new and trending, so this course is a good choice.
Why Scrum?
Scrum is an agile framework for developing, delivering, and sustaining complex products.
Scrum being described as a lightweight framework means that it is intentionally kept simple and minimalistic, providing just enough structure to support the development process without being overly prescriptive. This allows teams to adapt and customize their practices to fit their specific context and needs.
Scrum Master is one of the highest paid jobs with average salary ranging from 97,000$ to 150,000$ per year. You can also search on Linkedin about available job opportunities for Scrum Master and their expected salaries.

courses.title: Agile Project Portfolio Management - Part 2/2
courses.bio: Learn the key concepts of project portfolio management and Agile project management
objectives: Understanding of the basics of project portfolio management

requirements: Knowledge of Project Management
courses.description:
This course is a result of 25 years of consulting project and portfolio management experience and participation in project portfolio management (PPM) implementations at multiple companies.
The first part of the course will focus on definitions and descriptions of the key concepts of project portfolio management and Agile project management. First, we will examine several case studies that would help us to define the three pillars of project portfolio management: maximizing the project value, balancing the project mix and alignment of your company’s portfolio to its strategy.
Then we will examine the differences between project management and project portfolio management as well as the zones where they overlap and support each other. We will conclude the Project Portfolio Management overview with several reasons why bad things usually happen if portfolio management is ignored.
Consequently, we will also discuss Agile Project Management and its key components like Agile core values, Agile project processes and comparisons between Agile and Waterfall approaches.
In the second part of the course, we will examine the proposed Agile Project Portfolio Management processes starting from the High-Level Design Document (HLD) to Low-Level Design Document (LLD) to Development and Release. We will also discuss Agile resource allocation and Agile release management.
Finally, I will demonstrate to you – using real-life project documents the complete journey of one project I have worked on through the entire Agile PPM pipeline, from inception to the final delivery.
target_audience: You want to understand the basics of Agile project portfolio management
You want to assess the costs and benefits of the project being proposed to your organization
You plan to participate in the Agile project assessment committee

requirements: Basic understanding of computer
courses.description:
This course is prepared for those who want to master the Java Programming Language. Java offers a robust and secure environment for developing a wide range of applications, from desktop and web-based software to complex enterprise-level systems and mobile applications. Its object-oriented nature emphasizes encapsulation, inheritance, and polymorphism, making code modular, reusable, and easier to maintain. Moreover, Java boasts a rich standard library (Java API) that provides pre-built functionalities, simplifying tasks like data handling, networking, and graphical user interface (GUI) creation.
One of Java's distinguishing features is its platform independence, achieved through bytecode. When Java code is compiled, it generates an intermediate form known as bytecode, which is executed by the JVM. This architecture decouples the program from the underlying hardware, enabling it to run on any platform that supports JVM, such as Windows, macOS, and Linux.
Java also excels in multithreading, allowing programs to perform multiple tasks simultaneously, which is essential for modern, responsive applications. Its security features, such as sandboxing and cryptographic libraries, make it a preferred choice for developing secure systems.
Java’s versatility, reliability, and cross-platform capabilities have cemented its place as one of the most popular and enduring programming languages. From powering large-scale enterprise systems to mobile apps and web services, Java remains a cornerstone of the software development world, evolving continually to meet the demands of modern computing.
target_audience: If you want to be Java Developer and software engineer, this course is definitely for you!

A BIM Execution Plan (BEP), also known as a BIM Implementation Plan, is a comprehensive document that helps project participants move forward with clear roles and expectations. A BEP is an essential element to create before beginning any construction project, especially for those that are large or complex with many collaborators.
Through clear roles, responsibilities and real-time communication, a BEP keeps all in sync while ensuring construction stays on track. This is vital when adhering to tight schedules. A thoughtful plan also makes sure details don’t fall through the cracks or become last-minute change orders that cause delays.
A thorough a BEP is a powerful project accountability tool that keeps work moving forward throughout the various phases of planning and construction. A well-coordinated project starts with a well-crafted BEP.

The aim of the Lean approach is to reduce waste wherever possible, so knowing about these wastes is a crucial first step in deploying a Lean approach within your organization. In this course we will:
- Explore what the wastes are, breaking them down one by one.
- Look at examples of the different types of waste you may see.
- Discuss how to spot them and where they could arise.
- Go through a range of real life examples of processes plagued with waste, and show you how to conduct a process analysis with the 8 wastes at the heart of that effort.
- We will also introduce you to Lean.
By the end of this course, you will have the knowledge and confidence to deliver a full end to end 8 wastes analysis within your key processes, know how to spot, analyze and remove waste where it is and know how to educate and inform others of this effort, spreading the Lean approach across your organization.

courses.title: Agile, Scrum & Kanban Practice Tests & Interview Questions
courses.bio: Test & Improve your Agile & Scrum skills | All topics included | Practical exercises | Common Interview Questions
courses.description:
Agile software development refers to software development methodologies centered around the idea of iterative development, where requirements and solutions evolve through collaboration between self-organizing cross-functional teams. The ultimate value in Agile development is that it enables teams to deliver value faster, with greater quality and predictability, and greater aptitude to respond to change. Scrum and Kanban are two of the most widely used Agile methodologies.

In Agile processes, there is constant feedback, allowing for team members to adjust to challenges as they arise, and stakeholders an opportunity to communicate consistently. Though originally created for software development, the Agile approach is now widely used in executing many different types of projects and in running organizations.

Agile grew from the minds of a group of software development project managers. Since then, it has continued to be popular in software development, but has expanded to many other industries as well. These include finance, IT, business, fashion, biotechnology, and even construction—among many others.


What does this course offer you?
This course consists of 4 practice tests.
Practice test consists of 25 questions each, timed at 30 minutes with 50% as passing percentage.
The questions are multiple-choice.
The answers are randomized every time you take a test.
Questions are of varying difficulty - from easy to moderate to tough.
Once the test is complete, you will get an instant result report with categories of strength to weakness.
You can re-take the tests over and over again as and when it suits you.
New set of questions will be added frequently and you can practice along without having to buy the course again.
Learning Resources will be shared over email frequently to all enrolled students, along with any latest updates/news/events/knowledge.

With this course you will get lifetime-long access to 100+ Interview and Practice Questions on Agile, Scrum & Kanban that are updated frequently. After the test you will become more confident in these areas and will be able easily perform basic and advanced tasks while working on any project - be it development of a software, or managing a team - these practices work in all areas of varied kind of domains. Not just that, you will have the required knowledge to pass the Agile & Scrum Certification Exams and also clear your next Job Interview !
But most important is that you will UNDERSTAND Agile & Scrum fundamentals.
You will also get 30-days money-back guarantee. No questions asked!
Don't wait and join the course now!

requirements: No prerequisites is needed.
courses.description:
JOIN THE PROFESSIONAL AND PRACTICAL ON-LINE COURSE PRESENTING AGILE-STYLE OBJECTIVE MANAGEMENT WITH OKR (OBJECTIVES KEY RESULTS) GOAL SETTING FRAMEWORK AND GIVING YOU LOT’S OF PRACTICAL HINTS & TIPS FOR IMPLEMENTING AND APPLYING OKR FRAMEWORK IN YOUR COMPANY AND/OR TEAM.
The three reasons for buying that course NOW
You will get a professional and a practical presentation of OKR (Objective Key Results) goal setting framework, i.e. an agile objectives management method covering: objectives definitions and planning, OKR process (planning, short-term review, quarterly summary- retrospective) and a lot of hints & tips for the implementation of OKR goal setting framework in your company and/or team.
Without leaving your home you will learn and/or harden everything you need for effective and efficient applying and adapting OKR goal setting framework to your business environment and ..a lot, lot more.
You will get and use knowledge and practical 25+ years’ experience of professionals in the area of management and product/project management, applying OKR goal setting framework in their business and project activities, i.e. in on-line courses production business and thinking, that OKR goal setting framework is a fantastic tool for goals management.
What is OKR goal setting framework?
OKR goal setting framework is an agile objectives management method. The method to be used by the company management, teams and employees in those teams to define company and – based on them – the department’s and team’s business goals, to review them in short term periods and to retro/review and evaluate them quarterly, to confirm the direction of the company, departments and teams or to adapt those activities in an agile way to changing business conditions and to current level of objectives achievement.
OKR goal setting framework enables company, departments and teams to focus on the key business goals, to align their activities vertically and horizontally, to adapt to the changing business conditions, to learn and to supply the knowledge, creativity and engagement of the company employees.
We are of the opinion – based on our usage of OKR goal setting framework, among others, for the production of our on-line courses – that OKR goal setting framework is very efficient and productive and also engaging approach for objectives management. It starts with objectives definition and planning, goes through short-term reviews (check-in’s) and ends with quarterly “big” review: drawing conclusions, learning and – if needed – correcting the course of activities.
For whom is that course?
Objectives management constitutes “the head” of every business activity. In he current VUCA times, with lot of volatility, uncertainty and complexity, objective management should be agile, enabling quick adaptation to the changing external and internal conditions. The vast majority of companies are nowadays operating in such conditions. Therefore OKR goal setting framework, i.e. agile objectives management can be applied in various companies, at the different management levels, like e.g. department and teams, both for business objectives as well as for objectives in project and product management.
Therefore regardless of:
You are the project manager, team leader within the project, business owner or Product Owner, defining the objectives, who would like to have an effective tool for your realization,
You are the project team member, Scrum Team member (Product Owner, Scrum Master, Development team member) involved in business objectives realization,
You are an expert and a professional, representative of a business, who would like to gain greater knowledge about objectives management,
You are a department or team manager and would like to effectively manage the objectives of your unit under the conditions of volatility, uncertainty and complexity,
You are the director, C-level executive or Board member and would like to effectively manage the company under the conditions of volatility, uncertainty and complexity.
This course is for you.
What is the course content?
Presentation of the objectives management context and of the importance of objectives for the business agility.
Presentation of the OKR goal setting framework: formula for the objectives definition; OKR process: planning, short term review and quarterly summary; mind-set required for the applying OKR goal setting framework.
Practical hints & tips for the implementation and usage of OKR goal setting framework in the company and teams.
Life-stories and puzzles.
Course is divided into chapters, including lessons about such detailed topics, as:
Traditional objectives management methods
Business agility and objectives
Agile objectives management
OKR goal setting framework: objectives formula
OKR goal setting framework – objectives management process
Examples of OKRs
Objectives alignment
Objectives in project management
Objectives in product management
Objectives and employee motivation

courses.title: Project Management - How to run an ERP project Part:1/2
courses.bio: Leading Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) projects
objectives: Introduction to the ERP projects
Lessons Learned from past ERP projects
ERP Project: Initiation and Planning
ERP Project: Initiation and Planning: Project Charter
ERP Project: Initiation and Planning: Requirements Approach
ERP Project: Initiation and Planning: Project Plan
requirements: Knowledge of Project Management
courses.description:
Embark on a transformative journey led by Jamal, a seasoned project management consultant with over 25 years of experience in managing major Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) implementations. This comprehensive two-part course is the culmination of his vast expertise in project and portfolio management, providing invaluable insights into the intricacies of running successful ERP projects.
In Part 1, we begin by defining ERP systems and exploring the industry outlook on ERP growth, as well as success and failure statistics associated with ERP implementations. Gain a holistic understanding of the ERP landscape and the factors that contribute to project outcomes.
Next, we delve into a real-life ERP project recently managed by Jamal. We examine the company type, project scope, constraints, and the project environment, enabling you to grasp the context in which ERP projects operate. Through an analysis of "Lessons Learned" from the project, we explore important aspects such as creating degrees of freedom, establishing an internal team of subject matter experts (SMEs), securing commitments from executives, conducting regular project rollout meetings, managing vendor relationships, addressing potential risks, and implementing effective requirements, communications, and testing approaches.
As we progress, we focus on project initiation and planning, providing a detailed examination of the Project Charter and Project Plan documentation derived from actual projects. Additionally, we delve into the Requirements Engineering approach, equipping you with the tools and techniques necessary for gathering and documenting project requirements effectively.
In Part 2 of the course, we compare planned schedules with actual schedules, analyzing any variances and striving to identify reasonable explanations for the gaps observed. This exercise helps you understand the dynamics of schedule management within ERP projects.
Moreover, we dedicate significant time to discussing various testing strategies, including test case creation, implementation of SWAT calls, leveraging vendor Super SMEs, effective ticket management techniques, ERP rollout meetings, generating status reports, and conducting in-depth discussions on access levels and training requirements.
Enroll in this comprehensive course led by Jamal, and gain the knowledge and insights needed to successfully run ERP projects. Acquire valuable skills and practical techniques that will enhance your ability to manage the complexities of ERP implementations and deliver successful outcomes.
target_audience: You are a project manager who plans to engage external vendors on his/her next project.
You are a business analyst who will be engaged on a project with vendor participation.
You are a senior executive who plans on initiating a project with a heavy procurement component.

courses.description:
Certification of Competency in Business Analysis (CCBA®) training course covers the basic skillsets essential for business analyst professionals based on the industry standards and yardsticks of the International Institute of Business Analysis (IIBA®).

CCBA® certified professional will become expert in distinguishing the needs of a business so that the most appropriate solutions can be acknowledged and implemented to produce consistent results with increased competence and steadiness.
CCBA® certification preparation course is intended for business analysts and practitioners who wish to be recognized as connoisseurs skilled at steering Business Analyst activities. Business analysts follow a specialized approach towards understanding the procedures, policies and structure of an organization by employing conventional set of methods in order to recommend the best possible solutions that drive the organization to achieve its goals.

Guiding business analysis activities include grasping the business processes to govern how they function to attain their purpose, and realizing which capabilities the organization requires to successfully provide its services to the peripheral participant. This incorporates the elucidation of organizational goals, how the goals are associated to objective, finding out the best way forward to act in order to fulfil these objectives, and also defining the interactions between different business units with its internal as well as external participants.
By the end of this CCBA® training, you will:
Acquire the knowledge and skills required to pass the CCBA® certification exam
Understand Business Analysis Key and core Concepts Model (BACCM)
Acquire cutting-edge knowledge of classifying, defining, assessing and finishing various elements of business analysis tasks.
Be able to achieve 30 business analysis tasks in 6 knowledge areas.
Understand 50 business analysis tools and techniques.
Benefits of IIBA Certification (CCBA®)
Upon Completion of this Course, you will achieve following: -
Defining training and professional development standards
Demonstrates to customers, competitors, suppliers, staff and investors that you use industry-standard business analysis practices.
Demonstrates to your investors that your business is run effectively.
Defining and maintaining the Business Analysis Body of Knowledge Guide

requirements: Preferably an understanding of Project Scope Management
courses.description:
Projects are the way of doing business and organisations need skilled people who can manage them and operate effectively in a project environment.  As more organisations adopt Project Management as the tool for the implementation of work, these skills are becoming ever so in demand.
Understand and Project Time Management.
This program has been drawn from International Project Management Best Practice and developed to meet the requirements of the relevant unit of competence within Nationally Recognised Certificate IV in Project Management Practice in Australia.
This course is delivered in a practical real world context and whilst it is supported by theory it focusses on delivering the practical skills you can apply directly to your projects.
If you are managing projects, working in a project team or affected by projects in one way or another this course is for you.  You will gain a practical insight into scope management exploring the following:
Introduction into Time Management:
Key Terminology and the importance of Time Management
Time management concepts and principles
Time management tools and methodologies
Understanding the WBS
Understanding the WBS and its purpose
Developing a WBS
Creating a Practical WBS
How to Estimate Time
How to estimate duration
How to estimate resources
3 Point estimation technique
How to Develop the schedule
How to sequence activities
Creating a WBT
Construct a network diagram
Working out the critical path
How to Control the Project’s Scope
How and when to monitor the schedule
Communicating with stakeholders
Making forecasts and looking forward
How to Reiview Management
How to review time performance
How to conduct lessons learnt
At the end of this program you will have a practical, working understanding of how to manage the scope of the Project.  By completing the activities, you will have met most of the requirements of the Nationally Recognised unit: Apply project time management techniques (BSBPMG410 ) as part of the Certificate IV in Project Management.
The reason for developing the course
I found that the resources provided to many students undertaking studies in Project Management were lacking.  They were either;
too theoretical, which prevented students applying it to their workplaces;
not engaging, such as books or PDFs;
hard to understand: using complex language to illustrate otherwise simple concepts; or
incorrect, usually written by people without a true and practical understanding of the subject.
Online learning is difficult- I know, I am the worst online student.  As a result, I have designed this course to provide students with an additional resource to enhance their understanding of the topic.  The course is based upon strong theoretical foundations, but delivered in a practical way- so you can apply what you learn to better your projects.
I have also tried to make the course engaging using a mix of visual and auditory delivery accompanied by tasks which you can use to test your knowledge and apply the concepts.  I have also tried to approach the subject in a casual way, which will hopefully make it a fun learning experience.
I have tried to keep the language to its simplest form, explaining industry words as I progress through the course.  This will enable you to understand the vocabulary used in Project Management, without being confused by it.
target_audience: Those working in Project Management

courses.title: Roadmap to Easy Transition from Traditional to Agile Models
courses.bio: Learn about major software development approaches & how to easily transit from traditional models to Agile
objectives: Develop a deeper understanding of the principles behind agile and traditional methodologies in order to design and tailor a project methodology that is well aligned with the business environment, the risks and complexities of individual projects.

Introduction: Software Life cycles and Software Models
Comparisons between the 2 Extremes: Agile vs Traditional Models Impact on Project Management

requirements: Basic software development and product life cycle understanding.
courses.description:
A major task in managing a software project is to select the right software methodology for your specific project needs.

It is not one size fits all, there’re many factors that you need to put into consideration before you decide the perfect approach to run your project.
You should not always go agile or always go traditional. Traditional approaches is all about control. Agile approaches is all about flexibility and accepting changes.
If you are an agile advocate then there are situations where extra control is needed. And if you are a traditional advocate then there are situations where extra agility is needed. So to decide on the best approach, I believe that you need to learn both: agile methodologies and traditional project methodologies. And this why this course is different.
it is not one way or the other, it is not black or white … it is not traditional versus agile … the reality is that most of the software projects are in between … there’s a wide spectrum between the 2 approaches and we need to learn how to decide which is the right methodology for your specific project circumstances.
In this course, we will learn the benefits, drawbacks and when to use most familiar approaches, we will also learn how different factors can affect your methodology selection, I will provide you with my personal recipe that I have successfully used for years to help you select the perfect methodology according to your specific project needs.
I will be happy to work with you to decide on the best software methodology for your specific projects and answer all your questions
target_audience: Software project managers.

startup owners and entrepreneurs.
Business Leaders, CIOs and PMO leaders.

courses.bio: Project and Portfolio Management Approach
objectives: The Causes of Project Failure

Project Failure: Case Examples: Kashagan Oil Field and USS Gerald R. Ford

requirements: No prior knowledge is required.
courses.description:
Welcome to the transformative course on Troubled Project Recovery, where you will delve into the complexities of project failures and learn how to effectively turn them around. Led by an industry expert, this course provides invaluable insights and practical strategies to rescue troubled projects.
Throughout this workshop-style training, we will explore the causes of project failures, challenge traditional notions of project success and failure, and examine the critical process of conducting troubled project audits. You will gain a deep understanding of how to analyze audit findings and leverage them to create, negotiate, and implement project recovery plans.
The course introduces a revolutionary project success rating model, which will equip you with a comprehensive framework for evaluating and rating project outcomes. By analyzing real-world examples, including the Kashagan Oil Field (Kazakhstan), USS Gerald R. Ford (USA), Krestovsky Stadium (Russia), Ibaraki Airport (Japan), and Channel Tunnel (UK-France), you will gain valuable insights into the root causes of project failures and the challenges faced in their recovery.
This course adopts a practitioner's perspective, emphasizing practical knowledge and real-world experiences. You can expect to uncover tricks, tips, and "guerrilla warfare" tactics employed by industry professionals to navigate troubled project situations successfully.
Join us now to gain the tools and expertise needed to address project failures head-on. Learn how to rescue troubled projects, mitigate risks, and steer them towards successful outcomes. This course is your gateway to becoming a proficient troubleshooter in project management, ready to take on any challenge that comes your way.

courses.description:
|| Unofficial Course ||
CAPM stands for Certified Associate in Project Management. It’s an entry-level certification offered by the Project Management Institute (PMI) for individuals who are new to project management or looking to build a strong foundation in the field.
This comprehensive course is designed to fully prepare you for the Certified Associate in Project Management (CAPM)® exam, while also providing a solid foundation in project management principles and practices. Whether you're a student, an entry-level project professional, or someone looking to transition into a project management career, this course will help you understand the critical knowledge areas outlined in the PMBOK® Guide and align with PMI's exam requirements.
You'll begin by learning about the CAPM certification itself—its value, eligibility criteria, and how it can enhance your career prospects. From there, you’ll dive into essential project management concepts, including what defines a project, the core functions of project management, and the responsibilities of a project manager.
As you progress, you'll explore how organizational culture, structure, and governance influence project success, as well as how stakeholders and governance frameworks shape project outcomes. You'll gain insight into the unique role of the project manager, learning key leadership and communication skills necessary to lead teams and drive results.
The course covers all the key knowledge areas, including integration, scope, schedule, cost, quality, resource, communication, risk, procurement, and stakeholder management. You'll learn how to initiate, plan, execute, monitor, and close projects effectively, using best practices and tools recognized by PMI. Real-world examples and exam-aligned content will help reinforce your understanding and prepare you to apply your knowledge in professional settings.
Additionally, the course introduces various project life cycles and development approaches—such as predictive, adaptive, and hybrid models—giving you a flexible understanding of how different methodologies apply in various environments. It concludes with a focus on ethics and professional responsibility, ensuring you're not only knowledgeable but also prepared to uphold PMI’s core values in your career.
By the end of this course, you'll be well-equipped with the knowledge, confidence, and tools to pass the CAPM exam and begin your journey as a capable and ethical project management professional.

The Project Initiation and Planning (PMI PMP) is course 1 of 28 of the Project Management Professional Certification Program (PMI-PMP). The course is aligned with the Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK6) developed by the Project Management Institute (PMI).
Projects are complex undertakings that require a high degree of coordination from start to finish. A lot goes into planning, getting the work done, monitoring progress, and finally, closing the project. In this course, you'll learn what project integration management involves and why it's important. Once you have an understanding of what's needed to manage project integration, you'll learn about the first two processes. These are what you use to create a project charter and develop a project management plan.
Project Integration Management

Exercise: Planning the Project
The Project Charter, in particular, serves as a crucial foundation. It provides a high-level overview of the project goals, stakeholders, constraints, and even initial risk assessments. This document becomes a point of reference for decision-making throughout the project's life cycle. The Project Management Plan takes it further, with a detailed plan for execution, communication, resource management, and more.
That’s it! Now go ahead and push that “Take this course” button, and see you on the inside!

Project delivered on time and budget... but plagued by defects or unhappy stakeholders? Quality isn't optional – it's fundamental to project success and delivering lasting value.
Failing to manage quality effectively leads to rework, increased costs, damaged reputations, and ultimately, failed projects. This course, part of the Project Management Fundamentals series, provides the essential knowledge and practical techniques to build quality into your projects from initiation to closeout.
Led by certified PMP® Luke Angel, you'll learn how to define, plan, manage, and assure quality throughout the project lifecycle, balancing requirements with cost and schedule constraints.
(What You'll Learn - Use Udemy's Curriculum Section for Detailed Topics):
Define & Plan Project Quality: Understand core quality concepts and components (function, performance, reliability) and develop effective quality management plans based on stakeholder needs.
Implement Quality Assurance (QA): Learn proactive processes and techniques to prevent defects and build quality into deliverables.
Apply Quality Control (QC) Tools: Master key tools and techniques like Pareto Diagrams, Control Charts, basics of Six Sigma, and House of Quality concepts to measure and control quality.
Understand the Cost of Quality: Analyze the financial impact of prevention, appraisal, and failure costs to make informed decisions.
Develop Effective Testing Strategies: Learn different testing approaches, including considerations specific to IT projects, to verify requirements are met.
Manage Quality Within Constraints: Balance quality efforts with project scope, schedule, and budget limitations.
Integrate & Manage Quality Issues: Understand how quality interacts with scope and change management, and effectively manage quality-related issues as they arise.

Project Managers responsible for overall project delivery.

courses.description:
Welcome to the PRINCE2 Foundation & Practitioner - 7th Edition Complete Guide. This comprehensive course is designed to equip you with a solid understanding of the PRINCE2 methodology, preparing you for both the PRINCE2 Foundation and PRINCE2 Practitioner certifications. With over 10+ hours of video content, this course will provide you with the skills needed to manage projects effectively using one of the world’s most recognized project management frameworks.
Whether you're a beginner or an experienced project manager, this course will guide you through PRINCE2's principles, themes, and processes, ensuring you're prepared to manage projects efficiently, on time, and within budget. Learn the essentials of project governance, risk management, quality assurance, and stakeholder engagement.


Why Take This Course?


Comprehensive Coverage: The course is aligned with the PRINCE2 7th Edition syllabus, ensuring you receive up-to-date training on the methodology.
Certification Preparation: Detailed preparation for both the Foundation and Practitioner exams, with practice tests, real-world examples, and case studies.
Practical Approach: Understand how to implement PRINCE2 in various industries, from IT to construction, through practical case studies and hands-on activities.
Flexible Learning: Learn at your own pace, with easy-to-follow videos, quizzes, and downloadable resources. Plus, lifetime access to the course material.


What Will You Learn?


Gain a deep understanding of PRINCE2’s 7 principles, including business justification, learning from experience, and managing by stages.
Master the 7 themes that guide project management decisions, from business case creation to risk management.
Learn to navigate through the 7 processes that ensure projects are controlled from initiation to closure.
Understand how to tailor PRINCE2 methodology to fit the size, complexity, and risk of different projects.
Use governance and leadership strategies to lead projects effectively.


Course Contents


Introduction to PRINCE2: Overview, structure, and how the methodology applies to real-world scenarios.
PRINCE2 Principles: Dive into the core principles that drive PRINCE2 methodology, ensuring project success.
Themes in PRINCE2: Learn about the key themes, such as Business Case, Organization, Quality, and more.
PRINCE2 Processes: A step-by-step guide through the processes to manage projects at every stage.
Tailoring PRINCE2: How to adapt the methodology to suit small, medium, or large-scale projects.
Exam Preparation: Full mock exams and practical quizzes to help you pass both Foundation and Practitioner exams.


Who Is This Course For?


This course is ideal for:
Aspiring project managers who want to gain a globally recognized certification.
Experienced professionals who wish to formalize their project management skills.
Business leaders who want to improve project outcomes.
Project team members interested in understanding the roles and responsibilities under PRINCE2.
Consultants and contractors looking to enhance their portfolio and credibility.


Salary Insights


Professionals with PRINCE2 certification can expect higher salary prospects. According to recent salary surveys:
Project Managers with PRINCE2 certification earn an average salary of $85,000 to $115,000 annually, depending on experience and location.
IT Project Managers can command salaries in the range of $95,000 to $120,000 per year.
Construction Project Managers with PRINCE2 can earn between $80,000 and $105,000 annually.
The demand for certified project managers is on the rise, with organizations valuing structured, disciplined approaches to project execution, making this certification highly valuable.


Why Choose This Course?


Practical Learning: Focus on real-world applications, tailored for industries like IT, construction, healthcare, finance, and more.
Immediate Access: Get started immediately with lifetime access to course material.
Industry-Relevant Skills: Enhance your career prospects by learning one of the most demanded project management methodologies globally.


Enroll now and start your journey to become a certified PRINCE2 professional today. Whether you are looking to advance in your current role or transition to a new project management position, this course will provide you with the skills and knowledge necessary to succeed.
