Construction Management Students

courses.title: Agile and Scrum: From Fundamentals to Advanced Practices
courses.bio: Learn principles of Agile and Scrum methodologies, and gain practical skills to effectively manage and deliver projects.
objectives: Understand the Agile mindset and its core principles.
Gain in-depth knowledge of the Scrum framework, roles, and events.
Learn techniques for value-driven delivery, including prioritization and MVP development.
Understand Agile compliance, contracts, and stakeholder management.
Develop skills in team performance, collaboration, and communication.
Master time-boxing, estimation, and problem-solving techniques.
Learn effective risk management and continuous improvement practices within Agile.
Apply Agile principles across various projects and contexts.

Benefits of Agile and Project Management: Benefits of Agile and Project Management Approach

requirements: Enthusiasm and determination to make your mark on the world!
courses.description:
A warm welcome to the Agile and Scrum: From Fundamentals to Advanced Practices course by Uplatz.


What is Agile?
Agile is a broader project management philosophy that encompasses a set of values and principles for guiding software development and other projects. It emphasizes customer collaboration, frequent delivery of working software, responding to change over following a rigid plan, and valuing individuals and interactions over processes and tools. Agile methodologies like Scrum are designed to promote transparency, continuous improvement, and rapid adaptation to changing requirements.


What is Scrum?
Scrum is a lightweight, agile framework designed to help teams develop complex products in an iterative and incremental manner. It provides a structured approach to project management, emphasizing flexibility, adaptability, and close collaboration among team members. At its core, Scrum breaks down large projects into smaller, manageable units called sprints, typically lasting two to four weeks. During each sprint, the team focuses on completing a specific set of prioritized tasks, with regular checkpoints and opportunities for adjustment to ensure the project stays on track and aligned with the evolving needs of stakeholders.


Scrum and Agile offer a framework for managing complex projects that emphasizes collaboration, flexibility, and customer satisfaction. They empower teams to deliver value more frequently, adapt to change, and continuously improve their performance.


How Scrum and Agile Work Together
Scrum and Agile are intrinsically linked, with Scrum being one of the most widely adopted Agile frameworks. Scrum provides a practical implementation of Agile principles through its defined roles, events, and artifacts.
Roles: Scrum involves three key roles: the Product Owner (responsible for defining product vision and prioritizing features), the Scrum Master (facilitates the Scrum process and removes obstacles), and the Development Team (self-organizing and cross-functional group responsible for delivering product increments).
Events: Scrum events include Sprint Planning (where the team plans the work for the upcoming sprint), Daily Scrum (a short daily meeting to discuss progress and challenges), Sprint Review (where the team demonstrates the completed work and gathers feedback), and Sprint Retrospective (a reflection meeting for the team to identify areas for improvement).
Artifacts: Scrum relies on three artifacts: the Product Backlog (a prioritized list of desired features), the Sprint Backlog (items selected for the current sprint), and the Increment (potentially shippable product functionality created during the sprint).


Main Features of Agile
Customer Collaboration: Agile teams prioritize understanding and fulfilling customer needs throughout the development process.
Adaptability to Change: Agile teams welcome change and can adjust their plans based on new information or evolving market conditions.
Focus on Working Software: The primary measure of progress is working software, rather than extensive documentation or planning.
Collaboration: Agile teams foster collaboration and open communication among all members.
Sustainable Pace: Agile teams aim to maintain a sustainable work pace that allows for continuous delivery without burnout.


Main Features of Scrum
Iterative and Incremental Development: The project is divided into short iterations (sprints), where the team focuses on delivering a potentially shippable product increment at the end of each sprint.
Self-Organizing Teams: Scrum teams are cross-functional and empowered to manage their own work, making decisions about how to achieve their sprint goals.
Time-Boxing: Each sprint has a fixed time duration, creating a sense of urgency and focus.
Transparency: Scrum emphasizes open communication and visibility into the team's work, progress, and challenges.
Continuous Improvement: Retrospectives at the end of each sprint provide an opportunity for the team to reflect and identify ways to improve their processes and performance.


Agile and Scrum: From Fundamentals to Advanced Practices - Course Curriculum


Introduction to Scrum and Agile
Scrum Agile Mindset and Principles
Benefits of Agile and Project Management Approach
Scrum Agile Methodologies and Mindsets
Scrum Definition and Three Pillars
Scrum Values
Scrum Roles and Features
Key Terms of Scrum
Extreme Programming
Feature-driven Development
Value-driven Delivery
Value-driven Delivery - IRR
Value-driven Delivery - Prioritization Techniques
Value-driven Delivery - MVP
Agile Compliance
Earned Value Management
Earned Value Metrics
Agile Contract and Types
Agile Stakeholder Management
Agile Stakeholder Needs and Understanding
Agile Personas
Agile Community Management
Agile Impediments Log
Agile Team Performance and Formation
Agile Team Performance - Management and Leaderships
Agile Collaboration and Brainstorming Technique
Agile Time-Boxing and Estimation Technique
Agile Problem Detection and Resolution Technique
Agile Risk Management Life Cycle
Agile Continuous Improvement and Continuous Development


Career Scope in Agile and Scrum
Completing a Scrum and Agile course can open doors to a variety of career opportunities. Agile can provide a solid foundation for a fulfilling career in project management, software development, or other fields where Agile methodologies are used. Some of the key potential career paths and job titles to pursue are:
Direct Scrum Roles:
Scrum Master: This is a core role in Scrum, responsible for facilitating the Scrum process, removing impediments, and ensuring the team adheres to Scrum values and practices.
Product Owner: This role is responsible for maximizing the value of the product by defining and prioritizing the product backlog. They work closely with the development team and stakeholders to ensure that the right product is being built.
Agile-Related Roles:
Agile Coach: Helps teams and organizations adopt and implement Agile practices effectively. They provide guidance, training, and mentorship to help teams improve their Agile maturity.
Agile Project Manager: Manages projects using Agile methodologies, ensuring that projects are delivered on time and within budget while maintaining high quality.
Release Train Engineer (RTE): Facilitates the coordination and alignment of multiple Agile teams in a Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) environment.
Roles Leveraging Agile Skills:
Business Analyst: Agile business analysts work closely with stakeholders to elicit and prioritize requirements, ensuring that the team builds the right product.
Developer/Tester: While not specifically Agile roles, developers and testers working on Agile teams need to understand Agile principles and practices to effectively contribute to the team's success.
Product Manager: Agile product managers focus on understanding customer needs and defining a product vision that delivers value.
Team Lead/Manager: Agile leadership roles focus on empowering and supporting teams to self-organize and achieve their goals.


Career Progression
With experience, individuals in these roles can move into more senior positions, such as:
Senior Scrum Master
Agile Program Manager
Enterprise Agile Coach
Director of Agile Delivery
target_audience: Scrum Masters and Agile Coaches: Aspiring or current Scrum Masters and Agile Coaches can deepen their understanding of the framework, enhance their facilitation skills, and learn techniques for guiding teams to success.

Product Managers and Product Owners: These roles play a crucial part in Agile projects, and the course can equip them with the knowledge to define product vision, prioritize features, and maximize value delivery.

Software Development Teams: Developers, testers, designers, and other team members involved in software development can gain practical skills in using Scrum to deliver high-quality products efficiently.
Beginners and newbies aspiring for a career in product management, project management, and agile management.
Anyone interested in scrum and agile practice and roles.
Project Managers: Project managers from any industry can benefit from understanding Agile principles and the Scrum framework to improve project planning, execution, and delivery.
Business Analysts: Agile business analysts play a key role in understanding and translating business needs into actionable user stories for the development team.
Team Leads and Managers: Those leading or managing Agile teams can benefit from understanding the principles and practices of Agile and Scrum to effectively support and empower their teams.

Executives and Stakeholders: A basic understanding of Agile and Scrum can be beneficial for executives and stakeholders to understand how projects are managed and how they can contribute to the success of Agile initiatives.

courses.title: CAPM 2025 REAL EXAM Q&As: STRAIGHTWAY TO PASS YOUR CAPM EXAM
courses.bio: CAPM Exam Prep - 2025 Simulator - 300+ VERIFIED REAL QUESTIONS - YOUR SHORTEST PATH TO CAPM CERTIFICATION
courses.description:
I- ABOUT THIS COURSE: YOUR SHORTEST PATH TO PASSING THE CAPM EXAM!
If you're ready to take your CAPM preparation to the next level, join this course today and get exclusive access to proven Q&As that will make a real difference in your exam results!
This course is designed to significantly boost your chances of passing the PMI CAPM exam by providing exclusive access to proven real Q&As. It offers comprehensive practice and targeted strategies to face exam day confidently.
*IMPORTANT NOTE*
This course is designed to complement your existing CAPM knowledge and practice. It will not take you from zero to hero, but it will make your path to success much smoother and more confident.
Before diving into this course for maximum benefit, ensure you have covered basic CAPM study material (like the PMBOK Guide or other foundational resources). Familiarity with the CAPM ECO exam domains is crucial.
I.1- WHAT YOU WILL GAIN & COURSE HIGHLIGHTS:
15-20% Higher Passing Probability: Mastering these carefully selected questions can significantly improve your chances of passing the CAPM exam on your first attempt.
300+ Questions Sourced From Actual Exams: Each question is meticulously crafted to reflect real-world scenarios and the style of the actual CAPM exam. All Q&As are verified for accuracy and alignment with current exam standards.
Real Exam Experience Simulation: On average, a notable portion of questions similar in style and content to these may appear in your actual CAPM exam. Imagine confidently responding to questions you've already practiced, saving valuable time and reducing exam-day anxiety.
Expert Insights & Mindset: Understand the logic and reasoning behind answering CAPM questions effectively. This course helps you develop the mindset and approach of a high scorer.
Benchmark Your Readiness: Use this course to gauge the difficulty of the actual CAPM exam and familiarize yourself with its structure, question types, and time pressure.
Step-by-Step Solutions & Rationales: Learn the 'why' behind each answer with clear explanations, enhancing your critical thinking and understanding of core concepts.
Targeted Domain Practice: Questions cover all four CAPM domains, allowing you to identify and strengthen weaker areas.
I.2- WHO SHOULD ENROLL:
Aspiring CAPM candidates looking to enhance their preparation with high-quality, exam-like practice questions.
Professionals who have a basic understanding of CAPM concepts and wish to pass the exam confidently on their first attempt.
Individuals who want a realistic preview of the CAPM exam's difficulty level and question style.
Students who have taken other CAPM prep courses or studied foundational materials now seek robust practice to solidify their knowledge and test their readiness.
I.3- HOW DO YOU SELF-ASSESS ON THE FIRST ATTEMPT USING THIS COURSE?
Your initial practice test results within this course are key to measuring your readiness:
Less than 50% Correct: Intensive review of foundational CAPM material is needed alongside practice.
50% to Less than 60% Correct: You're on the right track—focus on reviewing explanations for incorrect answers and keep practicing.
Over 60% Correct: You're showing good preparation for the exam; continue to refine and aim for higher consistency.
Over 70% Correct: You're likely well-prepared to tackle the exam and achieve a passing score.
II- ABOUT THE CAPM CERTIFICATE
The Certified Associate in Project Management (CAPM) certification is a globally recognized credential that validates your foundational knowledge in project management. Offered by the Project Management Institute (PMI), it demonstrates your understanding of the principles, processes, and terminology essential for effective project participation. Achieving CAPM certification boosts your professional credibility, establishes your commitment to the field, and opens doors to entry-level and advancing career opportunities in diverse project environments.
II.1- The CAPM 2025 Exam
The CAPM exam assesses your understanding of project management fundamentals through a balanced mix of questions designed to evaluate both theoretical knowledge and its practical context:
Total Questions: 150 (135 scored + 15 unscored pre-test questions)
Question Formats: Multiple-choice, matching, fill-in-the-blank, and more - ensuring a comprehensive evaluation of your project management foundational skills.
Exam Content Divisions: (Based on the current CAPM Examination Content Outline)
Domain I: Project Management Fundamentals and Core Concepts – 36%
Domain II: Predictive, Plan-Based Methodologies – 17%
Domain III: Agile Frameworks/Methodologies – 20%
Domain IV: Business Analysis Frameworks – 27%
II.2- Exam Content Overview
Domain I: Project Management Fundamentals and Core Concepts (36%)
Understand core project management concepts, principles, the project environment, and the role of the project manager.
Specific Focus Areas:
Project life cycles
Project phases
Planning processes
Organizational structures
Project roles
Five process groups
Domain II: Predictive, Plan-Based Methodologies (17%)
Apply traditional, plan-driven approaches to manage projects throughout their lifecycle.
Specific Focus Areas:
Predictive planning (scope, schedule, cost)
Tools & techniques
Managing constraints
Risk management
Monitoring & control
Procurement
Stakeholder engagement
Domain III: Agile Frameworks/Methodologies (20%)
Comprehend agile principles, values, and various agile methodologies.
Specific Focus Areas:
Agile Manifesto
Common agile frameworks (Scrum, Kanban)
Adaptive planning
Servant leadership
Agile estimation
Communication
Risk management.
Domain IV: Business Analysis Frameworks (27%)
Grasp the fundamentals of business analysis and its importance in identifying needs and recommending solutions.
Specific Focus Areas:
Role of business analysis
Stakeholder analysis
Requirements gathering & management
Traceability
Supporting scope definition
Delivering business value.
III- WHERE TO GET MORE SUPPORT?
Upon enrollment, you can ask questions through the course Q&A or via direct messaging. Our dedicated support team, including certified CAPM or PMP professionals, is on hand to provide prompt and expert guidance throughout your preparation journey.
Don't wait! Enroll now and significantly increase your CAPM exam readiness with tried-and-true questions verified by experienced professionals!

courses.title: PMP Exam Preparation Test Bank - 2025
courses.bio: PMP Exam Preparation in Domains (People, Process, Business Environment)
courses.description:
Creating a comprehensive test bank for PMP exam preparation involves covering key objectives from the PMBOK® Guide, ensuring thorough preparation across all knowledge areas and process groups. The test bank is designed to simulate the PMP certification exam experience, offering a variety of question types to assess understanding and application of project management principles.


Test Bank Objectives


The PMP exam test bank covers five main process groups and ten knowledge areas essential for project management proficiency:


1. Initiating
- Develop Project Charter: Questions focus on creating a document that authorizes the project and empowers the project manager with necessary resources.
- Identify Stakeholders: Assessments cover identifying and analyzing stakeholders' interests, involvement, and impact on project success.


2. Planning
- Develop Project Management Plan: Includes questions on integrating all subsidiary plans into a cohesive project management plan.
- Plan Scope Management: Addresses creating a plan that defines and controls project scope throughout its lifecycle.
- Collect Requirements: Tests understanding of gathering and documenting stakeholder needs to define project scope.
- Define Scope: Questions involve detailing project deliverables, acceptance criteria, and exclusions.
- Create WBS: Assesses ability to decompose project deliverables into manageable components.
- Plan Schedule Management: Covers developing policies and procedures for scheduling project activities.
- Define Activities: Involves identifying and documenting specific tasks required to produce project deliverables.
- Sequence Activities: Tests knowledge of establishing activity dependencies and order.
- Estimate Activity Durations: Includes questions on estimating time and resources required for project activities.
- Develop Schedule: Assesses skills in creating a project schedule based on activity sequences and resource constraints.
- Plan Cost Management: Questions cover methods for estimating, budgeting, and managing project costs.
- Estimate Costs: Involves calculating monetary resources needed to complete project activities.
- Determine Budget: Tests ability to aggregate costs into an approved cost baseline for project execution.
- Plan Quality Management: Addresses planning and implementing quality management activities.
- Plan Resource Management: Covers identifying and documenting project roles, responsibilities, and reporting relationships.
- Plan Communications Management: Involves determining communication needs and methods for stakeholders.
- Plan Risk Management: Tests understanding of risk management planning, identification, analysis, response planning, and monitoring.
- Identify Risks: Assesses ability to identify and document potential project risks.
- Perform Qualitative Risk Analysis: Tests skills in prioritizing risks for further analysis or action.
- Perform Quantitative Risk Analysis: Involves numerically analyzing risks' impact on project objectives.
- Plan Risk Responses: Covers developing strategies for enhancing opportunities and reducing threats.
- Plan Procurement Management: Tests knowledge of planning purchases and acquisitions.
- Plan Stakeholder Engagement: Involves developing approaches to involve stakeholders based on their needs and expectations.


3. Executing
- Direct and Manage Project Work: Questions cover leading and executing project activities as planned.
- Manage Project Knowledge: Involves using existing knowledge and creating new knowledge to achieve project objectives.
- Manage Quality: Addresses translating quality management plans into quality activities.


4. Monitoring and Controlling
- Monitor and Control Project Work: Tests skills in tracking, reviewing, and regulating project progress and performance.
- Perform Integrated Change Control: Involves reviewing and approving changes to project scope, schedule, or cost.
- Validate Scope: Assesses formalizing acceptance of completed project deliverables.
- Control Scope, Schedule, and Costs: Questions cover monitoring and managing changes to baseline plans.
- Control Quality and Resources: Involves ensuring project results and physical resources meet quality and project requirements.
- Monitor Communications: Tests ensuring timely and appropriate collection, distribution, storage, and ultimate disposition of project information.


This structured approach prepares candidates to effectively apply project management principles in various scenarios, equipping them to succeed in the PMP certification exam and in their project management careers.
target_audience: Project Managers
Aspiring Project Managers

courses.description:
“Project Cost Management and Sales Forecasting with Excel Course" depends on my 20 years’ experience as a project manager in digital communication and gaming projects. I will explain to you how you can manage your project costs and finish your projects in your budget limits.
In this course we will work on 4 case studies.
First of all, we will design a project budget proposal for a client project with our profit margin.
Our next case study will be estimating our project costs and budget for a short-term project.
The third case study will be designing an Ad-Sale conversion table in excel with simplified formulas.
And finally, we will make calculations about our sales and we will have a Sales Forecast Template.
All of these 4 files will be useful assets for your future projects, startups and entrepreneurships. After finishing the course, you will learn how you can change and adjust them for your business.
Financial problems and calculations can be tricky for technical persons and startup owners. I know you want to concentrate on your product or services and do not want to give too much time and effort for cost and budget analyses. I was in the same situation with you and developed my excel files for non-financial people, they are easy to use, practically can be implemented to any project and robust.
If you are diving to any kind of project, enroll to Project Cost Management Course today and speed up your financial analysis process.

This course includes coverage of traditional, Agile and hybrid projects and development approaches. this is and English course, with english slides and vocabs and terminology explanation PMI Project Management Professional PMI course is aligned 100% with the latest PMI Authorized PMP Exam Content Outline (ECO) and is based on the latest PMI authorized material. the instructor of this course is an authorized learning partner certified instructor meaning that you will satisfy the required hours exam prerequisite and you will also be able to claim PDUs if you are a PMP already.
This course will include the following:
PMI PMP project management education needed to apply for your PMP exam.
Exam Simulation (exam like) Mockup Test Questions
Based on the latest PMP Examination Content Outline (ECO)
Expert instructions from a certified PMP Instructor and a project management professional, building information management professional, AUTODESK publisher, Author, & Developer.
The instructor is authorized from PMI, Autodesk, Jordan engineers association, Qatar Engineers Committee, Saudi Council of Engineers, RICS Project BIM Management and many other relevant authorities
The instructor holds the Engineering Bachelor Degree, and the Engineering Management Master Degree.
Full Series of  Videos
Tips & Tricks of exam questions
Expert instructions filling out the PMP application
Mockup exam questions
We do monthly support hundreds & thousands to pass their PMP certification exam & we can help you as well.


PASS YOUR PMI PMP EXAM!


the course is split in 6 sections as follows:
1- Introduction and exam characteristics/statistics
2-  Lesson 1 Create a High-Performing Team
Lesson Objectives
In this lesson, you will learn how project managers and teams:
• Determine project team member requirements, appraise team skills, and maintain team knowledge transfer.
• Collectively define project ground rules based on context, such as organizational rules and team dynamics.
• Determine a negotiation strategy and negotiate project agreements.
• Organize around team strengths and support team task accountability.
• Ensure team members and stakeholders are adequately trained.
• Continually evaluate the effectiveness of virtual team member engagement.
• Reach consensus and support the outcome of the parties’ agreement.
3- Lesson 2 Starting the Project
Learning Objectives
In this lesson, you will learn how project managers and teams:
• Assess project needs, complexity, and magnitude to determine the appropriate project methodology/methods and practices.
• Plan and manage the scope.
• Plan, prepare, modify, and manage the project schedule based on methodology.
• Plan and manage the budget and resources.
• Plan and manage the quality of products and deliverables.
• Integrate project planning activities.
• Plan and manage procurement strategy.
• Establish the project governance structure.
• Plan and manage project/phase closure.
4- Lesson 3 Doing the Work
Lesson Objectives
In this lesson, you will learn how project managers and teams:
• Assess and manage the risk landscape inherent in every project.
• Execute a project to deliver business value.
• Manage the communications in a project.
• Engage all project stakeholders.
• Create project artifacts.
• Manage project changes.
• Manage project issues.
• Ensure knowledge transfer to ensure project continuity.
5- Lesson 4 Keeping the Team on Track
Lesson Objectives
In this lesson, you will learn how project managers and teams:
• Inspire, motivate, and influence team members and stakeholders.
• Appraise team performance against key performance indicators.
• Determine, prioritize, and remove impediments, obstacles, and blockers for the team.
• Investigate and interpret the source and stage of a conflict and recommend an appropriate conflict resolution solution.
• Evaluate stakeholder engagement needs and influence stakeholders to accomplish project objectives.
• Recognize mentoring opportunities and mentor relevant stakeholders.
• Promote team performance through the application of emotional intelligence.
6- Lesson 5 Keeping the Business in Mind
Lesson Objectives
In this lesson, you will learn how project managers and teams:
• Determine necessary approach and action to address compliance needs.
• Evaluate delivery options to achieve benefits and value.
• Continually review internal and external business environment for impacts on project scope/backlog.
• Evaluate the impact of the project to the organization and determine required actions.
• Assess the existing continuous improvement framework and execute continuous improvement steps.


7- Mockup exam tests/questions


This is the end of the course. Thank you for your participation and best of luck to you as you continue to take the PMP® Certification exam!

Our PMP® Exam-PMI 2025 Practice Test Series is tailored for the 2025 PMP® Exam and includes 6 full-length practice exams featuring 600 high-quality questions each.


Based on the PMBOK® Guide, 7th Edition, Latest PMP Examination Content Outline (ECO), the Agile Practice Guide, and other PMI-recommended resources, these tests cover all three domains—People, Process, and Business Environment—ensuring a comprehensive understanding of both traditional and agile methodologies. The questions vary in difficulty to challenge your critical thinking and reinforce your mastery of core concepts such as Integration, Scope, Risk, Quality, and Stakeholder Management.


Key Features of This Course:
6 Full-Length Exams: Each test mirrors the real PMP® exam format, helping you build familiarity and confidence.

Realistic Simulation: Experience the pressure of time management and adapt to the question styles and tricky scenarios you’ll encounter on the actual exam.


Whether you’re a first-time PMP® candidate or retaking the exam, this practice test series is your ultimate preparation tool.


Why Choose This Course?
Our tests not only focus on content mastery but also on exam strategy—equipping you with the tools to tackle time constraints and complex question scenarios. Enroll now and embark on your PMP® journey with confidence!

courses.description:
Are you a beginning project manager looking to improve your project management and communication with your project team and stakeholders?
A one-page summary of your project is a MUST HAVE tool for anyone who engages in project management.  We call this a "Project Charter."  Use it to communicate with project sponsors, key leaders in the organization, and cross-functional project team members.
In this course, we walk you through our 1-page project charter template, provide project charter examples and explain key project management concepts along the way.  You'll boost both your project management and business communication skills in no time!


COURSE OUTCOMES
Key information in one place -->  Our proven Project Charter Template is a great tool to help you, the project manager, get your head wrapped around the project.  It's a living document you'll update as you go along.
Project communication --> Use this template to improve your communication of key facts to stakeholders and get project buy in from sponsors, team members and others in your organization.
Project management tutorial --> Learn key project management concepts:  building a project team, stakeholder management, use of sponsors, writing an impactful project description, and sketching out project milestones.
Examples, Examples, Examples --> we use lots of relatable examples as we go along including bonus time answering questions we often get in our live project management workshops.
Practice, Practice, Practice -->  Follow along and share your practice assignments, ask questions and we'll respond with feedback.
What makes us special as instructors? We're lifelong program managers with experience in the high tech, manufacturing and service industries.  We've created project charters for all kinds of projects in our professional and personal lives and will help you create one for your project too.
What does this course include?
45 minutes of video
10 lessons
7 assignments
Real-world examples
Learning aids
A practical, well-tested charter template
Certificate of Completion
Join us!
Debbie & Jenny

courses.description:
For current and future Scrum Masters, Product Owners and team members. In this course, you will master the Scrum framework, including its roles, events, artifacts, and values.
Scrum is a lightweight framework that helps people, teams, and organizations generate value through adaptive solutions for complex problems. This course is structured to provide you with a complete understanding of Scrum and how it works.
The Scrum Team creates a Product in Sprints. We will thoroughly discuss this statement throughout the course. You will learn about:
the history of Scrum, its foundation, and the 3 empirical pillars that support it.
The Scrum Team, its qualities, and the 5 values its members live by.
The Product and the heartbeat of Scrum – the Sprint, as a container for all the work the Team does.
3 artifacts and commitments.
The Product Owner role, the Product Backlog with the Product Goal, and the activity of Product Backlog Refinement.
The Developers and the Scrum Master accountabilities.
The Events (meetings) in Scrum, starting with the Sprint Planning event with the Sprint Backlog artifact and the Sprint Goal commitment.
The Daily Scrum events, the Increment of Product functionality with the Definition of Done as a commitment to quality, and the Sprint Review event.
Lastly, you will learn about the Sprint Retrospective event.
By the end of this course, you will have a complete understanding of Scrum and how to apply its process, elements, and principles to iteratively and incrementally create a Product in an uncertain environment.
target_audience: Anyone interested in Scrum, whether you are completely new to it or have some experience but want to deepen your understanding.
Anyone who works in software development.
Scrum masters, Agile coaches, PMOs, Transformation consultants.
Project managers, Product managers, Delivery managers, Process managers.

requirements: You need a PC/laptop with a good internet connection.
The motivation to learn new things.
courses.description:
Kanban and Trello: Boost Your Productivity and Organization - "Learn the Best Techniques to Streamline Your Workflow, Manage Tasks Effectively, and Achieve Your Goals in 2023
Do you ever feel overwhelmed with the amount of tasks and projects you have to juggle? Are you struggling to keep up with deadlines and organize your workflow?
Without proper organization, it's easy to fall behind on projects or miss important deadlines. This can lead to missed opportunities, stress, and decreased productivity.
Kanban and Trello are here to help! Learn the best techniques for managing tasks, streamlining your workflow, and achieving your goals. With Kanban and Trello, you can quickly stay on top of all your projects and get things done faster than ever before!


A craftsman can only be as good as his tools. For anyone who works digitally, Trello is arguably one of the best toolboxes out there.
This course has exactly one mission: you'll learn how to take your productivity to a whole new level. To start, we'll look together at how leading companies at the top of the world use Kanban techniques to get more output in less time. These techniques are the foundation for turning Trello into a productivity machine.
A machine that will not only give you more visibility, but one that will make copy-paste a thing of the past starting today. An intensive guide to automation will allow you to reduce the time you spend on communication, documentation and planning by more than 90%, with better results. How do we know this? We implement exactly that and see the results every day.
Meetings - are only maximally effective and goal-oriented - then they suddenly become fun again. Coordination of project teams of any size? Works easily and clearly. We have years of practical experience in the use of the program, from which you can benefit.
But also privately we are real fans of Trello - no matter if it's for an optimal and motivating overview of your own goals or as a tool for finances. You will learn all these applications here.


Whether you're a busy professional, a freelancer, or a student with a hectic schedule, this course will equip you with the best techniques to streamline your workflow, manage tasks effectively, and achieve your goals in 2023.
You'll learn how to leverage the power of Kanban and Trello to simplify your task management, prioritize your work, and stay on top of your deadlines. You'll discover the key principles of Kanban, including visualizing your work, limiting work in progress, and continuously improving your workflow.
Through step-by-step tutorials and real-world examples, you'll also gain practical skills in using Trello to create boards, cards, and lists, collaborate with team members, and automate your workflow. Whether you're new to Trello or a seasoned user, you'll learn tips and tricks to boost your productivity and stay organized. At the end of this course, you'll have the confidence and skills to take control of your workload and achieve your goals in 2023. So what are you waiting for? Sign up now and start your journey to productivity and organization with Kanban and Trello!


Get organized and boost your productivity with Kanban and Trello!
Kanban and Trello are the perfect tools to help you streamline your workflow, manage tasks effectively, and achieve your goals. Learn the best techniques to maximize your productivity and organization with these powerful tools.
Maximize your productivity and organization with Kanban and Trello! Take control of your workflow, get tasks done faster, and reach your goals faster than ever before.
Start boosting your productivity and organization today with Kanban and Trello! Get the best techniques to streamline your workflow, manage tasks effectively, and achieve success in 2023.
target_audience: Trello is a powerful tool professionally and privately
More organization for you and your goals?
More efficient communication?
More overview of projects?
If this sounds helpful to you, you've come to the right place!

courses.title: The Construction Machine
courses.bio: Learn how to take advantage of the on-going labor shortage and start your own construction business from the ground up.
objectives: Learn how to find your niche in this wide-open industry

Material management: how to connect with suppliers, perform take-offs, and get materials to the jobsite

courses.title: Certified Associate in Project Management CAPM Exam
courses.bio: Pass the CAPM with this course review. The material has been updated to reflect the Jan 2023 curriculum update.
objectives: Project management fundamentals and core concepts
Predictive, plan-based methodologies
Agile frameworks/methodologies
Business analysis frameworks
Demonstrate an understanding of product roadmaps.
Determine how to plan project iterations.
Demonstrate an understanding of a project management plan schedule.  Apply critical path methods.  Calculate schedule variance.
requirements: Have a secondary degree, such as a high school diploma, GED (general educational development), or global equivalent
At least 23 hours of project management education completed before the exam. This course will provide you a certificate for 23 hours of training to meet the criteria.
courses.description:
The published tasks include:
Domain 1: Project management fundamentals and core concepts 36%
Demonstrate an understanding of the various project life cycles and processes
Demonstrate an understanding of project management planning
Demonstrate an understanding of project roles and responsibilities
Determine how to follow and execute planned strategies or frameworks (e.g., communication, risks, etc.).
Demonstrate an understanding of common problem-solving techniques
Domain 2: Predictive, plan based methodologies 17%
Explain when it is appropriate to use a predictive, plan-based approach.
Demonstrate an understanding of a project management plan schedule.
Determine how to document project controls of predictive, plan-based project
Domain 3: Agile Frameworks Methodologies 20%
Explain when it is appropriate to use an adaptive approach.
Determine how to plan project iterations.
Determine how to document project controls for an adaptive project.
Explain the components of an adaptive plan.
Determine how to prepare and execute task management steps.
Being Developed:
Predictive artifacts examples
JIRA overview for adaptive
Domain 4: Business Analysis Frameworks (27%)
Demonstrate an understanding of business analysis (BA) roles and responsibilities.
Determine how to conduct stakeholder communication
Determine how to gather requirements.
Demonstrate an understanding of product roadmaps.
Determine how project methodologies influence business analysis processes.
Disclaimer:

Exam preparation materials are not sponsored by any other industry organization.
target_audience: Planning to appear in Project Management Institute's CAPM exam

According to Entrepreneur Media, Inc., the Certified Associate in Project Management (CAPM) ranks #1 among the 9 Most In-Demand Professional Certifications. Earning your CAPM credential can significantly boost your career prospects, enhance your earning potential, and prepare you to pursue advanced certifications—such as the Project Management Professional (PMP), the industry’s gold standard. A CAPM certification opens doors to a variety of project management roles, including: Assistant Project Manager Project Administrator Project Analyst Project Coordinator Project Manager PMI Technical Project Manager This certification is ideal for professionals looking to launch or grow a career in project management.

courses.title: PMP Exam Module-Wise Practice Tests: Topic-Based Questions
courses.bio: A must-have PMP exam prep resource to help you discover areas for improvement before starting your PMP Mock Exams.
courses.description:
A fail-fast approach provides early feedback! If you want to make your PMP exam preparation more effective, this topic-wise practice question set will help you validate your understanding of project management concepts even before taking mock exams. This valuable resource will accelerate your learning process. Plan-Inspect-Adapt!
The practice questions are based on the latest PMP Exam Content Outline, PMBOK 6, PMBOK 7, and the Agile Practice Guide. They closely mimic the actual exam in terms of difficulty level, wording, and scenarios.
You can use this resource alongside your PMP exam study plan and take the relevant module tests after completing each lesson or topic in your study plan.
Test Modules:
Scope Module – 33 Questions
Schedule - 36 Questions
Cost Modules – 20 Questions
Resource, Procurement - 23 Questions
Quality Module – 17 Questions
Risk Module - 19 Questions
Integration Module – 21 Questions
Stakeholder & Communication Module - 15 Questions
Team Management (People Domain) Module – 39 Questions
Business Domain Module – 23 Questions
Note: Due to Udemy's restriction of allowing only maximum of 6 practice tests per Course, I have combined some modules and created a total of six module tests. However, inside the description of each module test, you will find a breakdown of which questions belong to which module.
Additionally, your scores will be calculated module-wise. If a practice test includes questions from multiple modules, your results will be displayed separately for each module after completing the test.
Detailed explanations are provided for all questions, including both correct and incorrect answer choices.
These questions have been used by hundreds of PMP aspirants in Gantt Scholar's PMP online training, helping them ace their PMP exam on their first attempt.
Take your PMP certification exam preparation to the next level with this resource and ace your exam like a pro!
Happy learning!
Gantt Scholar
target_audience: This course is designed for learners preparing for the PMP certification exam and project management professionals, including Project Managers, Scrum Masters, Program Managers, Functional Managers, and more.

courses.title: CAPM Questions Bank-ECO 2025-PMBOK7 (6 Exams/900 Questions)
courses.bio: This course will help you pass CAPM exam on the first attempt. It will help you solve 900 real CAPM Q&A in 6 exams
courses.description:
*This course is updated to match the latest Exam Content Outline ECO from PMI.
Project management is a growing profession. The CAPM (Certified Associate Project Manager) certification is suitable for those who are interested in or are just starting a career in project management, as well as project team members who wish to demonstrate their project management knowledge.
Employers always seek for certifications in the candidates. CAPM is one of the most reputable certificates in project management provided by Project Management Institute PMI.
Project Management Institute is the most famous and reputable project management certification provider. It provides many certifications in project management like Project Management Professional (PMP), Agile Certified Practicioner (PMI-ACP), Risk Management Professional (PMI-RMP), Schedule Management Proofessional (PMI-SP), Program Management Professional (PgMP) and Portfolio Management Professional (PfMP)
In this course, we will help you to pass CAPM exam from the first attempt by solving 900 CAPM questions.
This course will help you to:
Be familiar with CAPM exam questions, environment and time.
Solve 6 CAPM mock exams.
Get ready to pass the CAPM exam from first attempt.
We finally wish you all the best in your learning journey and don't forget to rate the course (Five stars is the highest rating and one star is the lowest rating)
Best of luck
